title: Good, but could be better EDIT: It‚Äôs better!
text:
UPDATE: They *finally* added the ability to toggle ‚Äúimportant‚Äù status. I have notifications set to ‚Äúimportant only‚Äù so it‚Äôs a big deal to be able to manage this on the go. Also, the new layout is really nice. They‚Äôve managed to bring most of the full gmail experience to the mobile app. My rating has increased accordingly. 

*********

This app has made a lot of strides and improvements, but there‚Äôs a lot of functionality still missing. I have no idea why they continue to refuse to allow you to toggle the ‚Äúimportant‚Äù status of emails from the app.  Adding that in alone would probably make me bump my review one, and maybe two, stars, and it seems like it‚Äôd be easy to do.

title: support for non-default Star symbol in Gmail app
text:
I found the Star feature in Gmail to be incredibly useful ever since I‚Äôve changed the default yellow star (which is hard to see against a white or grey background) to a red square/exclamation sign. I also removed the default yellow star from the list of Star symbols in Gmail settings. So now when I click the Star option in the Gmail website UI, it correctly shows the red exclamation sign.

However, when I Star an email from the iOS Gmail app, it still uses the default yellow star instead of the exclamation symbol that I have as my default Star symbol in the Gmail settings. Please change that behavior so the app uses the Star symbols that are selected in the settings, instead of the default yellow star.

title: Notifications don‚Äôt work
text:
It‚Äôs been a year now and the notifications still don‚Äôt work. I‚Äôve tried everything. I‚Äôve even tried contacting the developers and I haven‚Äôt heard back once. I have the latest update for both my phone and the app, I‚Äôve tried deleting and reinstalling the app numerous times, I‚Äôve checked and triple checked that my notifications are on in both the app settings and my phone settings. Nothing. It‚Äôs frustrating and I don‚Äôt understand why this hasn‚Äôt been resolved. I‚Äôm disappointed in the lack of customer service. I‚Äôve never had any issues with this app until this past year. I miss time sensitive emails because of this glitch so that‚Äôs annoying. Would really appreciate if somebody helped and didn‚Äôt just send me to the help center (because it doesn‚Äôt help).
Update March 3: In response to the developer, I have sent feedback numerous times and things haven‚Äôt changed.

title: I wish message truncation were different
text:
The iOS app works great for all general use and I am happy with it. However, the behavior of truncating the display of longer messages is most annoying to me. It displays part of your message with a note ‚ÄúVIEW ENTIRE MESSAGE‚Äù at the point of truncation. You can click that hypertext to get the full message in a new window. I suppose the origin of this behavior is to limit cellular data usage. I don‚Äôt ever find that there is that much additional content that it is a major concern that I will use too much data. Quite often the message ends just beyond the truncation point. 

At the least, I wish the truncation threshold were user controlled, but ideally I would just be able to turn off the behavior.

title: Buggy! Bring back Inbox!
text:
I was forced to switch to the Gmail app after Google shut down Inbox. I used to love Gmail until I discovered Inbox and found how much easier and more intuitive it was to use. I received notifications that Inbox was being shut down and kept putting off the switch until one day I opened Inbox and was forced to download Gmail to see my email in an app format.
 I HATE IT! I thought it was just that I would need a period of readjustment time to get used to Gmail but it‚Äôs not just that. The fact that it is so buggy (e.g. trouble switching accounts, issues with simple settings, etc. ) drive me crazy. I have to close out of the app and reopen several times a day just to check my email. I‚Äôm even considering switching to Outlook (gasp!) just to avoid the buggy issues. 

I‚Äôm extremely disappointed in this app. Why didn‚Äôt google keep Inbox and shut down this one instead? I would have been ok if they rebranded Inbox as Gmail too.

title: Serious bug
text:
This app has a serious issue on iPhone X that needs resolving ASAP. I realized a few weeks ago that I would get gmail notifications but as soon as I‚Äôd hold the phone in front of me the notification would suddenly disappear completely rather than expanding to show its content. I‚Äôd then go into the gmail app and wouldn‚Äôt find any new emails. It wouldn‚Äôt happen every time and but was happening frequently.  This continued until I started missing important emails. So I looked around and found all of them in the TRASH. I had never deleted any of them. I didn‚Äôt even know that I had received those emails. 
but there is something with the facial recognition and this app that when you have a notification for an email and you hold your phone in front of your face it just erases the notification and deletes the email. I don‚Äôt have similar problem with other email apps on my phone so this is a gmail issue rather than Apple issue.

title: Unsend option disappears too quick
text: Overall I love Gmail, I love being able to create the different labels. I love the set up when two email accounts are merged together and the ease of switching back-and-forth. I like that I have the option to have access to both email accounts and either get all of the emails at the same time or switch back-and-forth. I prefer to switch back-and-forth because I don't want to check my school email all day every day. It is great that Google separates your promotions, social emails, and spam. My only complaint is this unsend option. The idea is great except I didn't even realize it was an option until recently and yet it's been out about a year. The option to understand disappears in one or maybe two seconds, that defeats the purpose. At least let it sit there for 20 seconds.

title: Horrible support for 2FA/account recovery!
text:
They make it pretty much impossible to recover your account! I had 2FA/Two Factor Verification set up with my mobile number as the second step. Unfortunately had to change my number due to identity theft/fraud but wasn't able to unlink the old one from my account before the change. Now I'm locked out of all my Google accounts.... photos, emails, etc, all held hostage. 

I have at least 3 of the last previous passwords I've used. (I try to change them frequently). Also, still have access to both the phone number I used prior AND my other email addresses that I originally linked to that account. The recovery process that everyone gets sent to is a joke and doesn't work. There has to be better way for me to verify and get my account back! Absolutely ZERO support/customer service for this issue. I know I'm not the only one! Google, step up and be better!

title: Decent app but ads appear in your inbox
text:
The app appears to have most of not all of the functionality of the gmail website and is relatively nice to use, but ads are something I find unacceptable in a mail app. The default mail app doesn‚Äôt give me ads and the only functionality that I really gain by using the gmail app is the inbox sorting. However, if I don‚Äôt want the sorting, can‚Äôt find a way to view my inbox unsorted unless I‚Äôm viewing a mixed mailbox of all my accounts. 

Maybe I‚Äôm just used to the default mail app, but the gmail app just gives fancy features I rarely find I need on mobile. If you need features like ‚Äúsend later‚Äù or other nice gmail features on your phone, and don‚Äôt mind ads, then the app is fine. I usually prefer to write emails on the computer anyway, so many of the features of the app are unnecessary for me and I absolutely detest the ads in my inbox, so I won‚Äôt be using it.

title: Not as good as Mail where it counts
text:
Gmail is nice with couple of huge inconveniences which make it hard to recommend over the default Mail app.

First, it provides no way to open links directly in Safari. There is a default app option labeled Safari, but it‚Äôs a lie. Gmail‚Äôs ‚ÄúSafari‚Äù is really an in-app browser. Whenever I tap a link in an email which leads to a site that requires authentication I see a 404, even when I‚Äôm signed in the system Safari browser. A second tap is required to open the url in system Safari. The ‚ÄúChrome‚Äù option opens it‚Äôs respective browser in one tap as you‚Äôd expect. Why the disparity? Likely so Google can track users more easily. I‚Äôm disappointed Apple hasn‚Äôt cracked down on this.

Second, it messes with the font size. The font is either much larger or much smaller, making messages harder to read.

title: Notification and Badging delays
text:
Gmail / Google is usually on top of things so I‚Äôm gonna give 4 stars because I know they‚Äôll fix it. 

For past few days my email accounts on iOS and even web browser has been getting notification delays. I have many accounts and some are acting better then others. In general it takes 15-20 minutes after actually receiving the email for the notification to post. I can check that by simply polling for email in web. 

Obviously I don‚Äôt want to refresh chrome on desktop forever and I want to rely on notifications again. 

Unsure if it‚Äôs related to latest update or if gmail is just having issues lately. Downdetecotr / twitter seem to have people reporting the same issues. 

Also when I got into app and read everything the badge will stay the number of unread I had before I opened app. I have to kill and relaunch app to get the badge to clear. 

Sometimes a toast message says no connection but I can access web, and even other google apps on my phone. 

I‚Äôm guessing it‚Äôs service related and not app per se. which is why I‚Äôm giving a 4 for a great app but acknowledging that service issues are making the app hard to use.

Gmail this is a ‚Äòno duh‚Äô moment: ‚Äúpin to top of inbox.‚Äù ‚ÄúMove sender to ‚Äòprimary‚Äô inbox. ‚ÄúPrioritize user-selected high-priority senders.‚Äù Allow us to mark certain words or phrases that we‚Äôd like to have as ‚Äòhigh priority,‚Äô and any emails containing those things gets put in primary or ‚Äòhigh priority‚Äô list, with option of pinning them to top.

So if you have other choices, try them. This app is more s pain in the ()&@ than it is worth.

title: Are you kidding me??
text:
There are 2 huge things wrong with the gmail app that 80% of users hate and yet google continues to do updates on the app and completely ignore these 2 very crucial problems. 

1- It doesn't allow you to turn off conversation view. It is awful. It's crazy to me that Google won't listen to thousands of complaints regarding this. 2- It won't allow you to add your signature right after your message.  It adds it at the very bottom of the string of conversations making it pointless to have a signature at all.  Someone would have to scroll all the way down to the bottom of the whole conversation to see your signature.  Who would do that??  How does google not see this as a problem?  And, do they mean to put the signature at the very bottom or is this a glitch?

Google stop wasting time on STUPID updates like this last one or on producing cars, and actually fix your basic problems with gmail.

title: Conversation View Ruins Otherwise Good App
text:
I use the app sparingly and only then because of how it interfaces with my Gmail account. The app would be one of, if not the best for email if you could turn off the inane and infuriating conversation view.

Google offers the option to turn off conversation view on the web version of Gmail but continues to ignore hundreds of thousands of complaints and requests from users for several years by not making it available on their mobile apps.

Countless users have documented tales of lost emails and important email that they didn‚Äôt know they had received because of it was grouped and hidden with other email in a ‚Äúconversation.‚Äù Yet Google has remained defiant in not offering the option to turn off conversation view in their mobile apps.

Google has made numerous ‚Äúimprovements‚Äù to the look and feel of this app over the years while ignoring this major issue for so many users.

Most other email apps offer the capability for users to choose to have conversation view on or off. For some reason only Google knows - because they have also refused to give any explanation to their loyal customers - the Gmail app remains a less than viable offering for anyone who doesn‚Äôt want to deal with the hassles and vulnerabilities of conversation view.

title: Need to turn off threading like webmail

Often I receive a simple 'OK' response message and don't wish to save it, so I want to delete it. But in the mobile app if I delete that message it moves the WHOLE thread to the trash.

So give me a way to separate emails in my mobile inbox so I can have the same sanity I do when sitting at a PC.

title: Lacks basic functions of web-based Gmail
text:
Google is one of the largest and most profitable companies in the world, and yet they‚Äôve never bothered to revamp their Gmail app to give users the same, basic functionality as web-based Gmail.  

For example, the Gmail app provides no formatting options other than bold, underline, and italics.  So, when composing an email, you can‚Äôt add bullet points or outline formatting.  You can‚Äôt indent.  You can‚Äôt change font size or color.  You can‚Äôt highlight or strikethrough text.  These are basic functions that the world‚Äôs most-used email app should provide.  

It‚Äôs 2023.  Google made $60 billion in net profits last year.  They obviously have the money and skill to revamp their Gmail app to give users the same, basic functionality as web-based Gmail.  Now they just need to care enough about their users to actually do it.  Please.  It‚Äôs time.  üôè
